dtliExcerpt: This production restores the deep melancholy that can be lost when the play is performed as a vaudeville turn, and it finds the terror within the comedy.
bwwExcerpt: "Give some credit to "9 to 5" - the overinflated whoopee cushion lodged at the Marquis Theater - for bucking this spring's fashion trends. Can this gaudy, empty musical really be part of the same Broadway season that gave us the minimally decorated, maximally effective "Exit the King," "God Of Carnage," "Next to Normal," "Hair," "Mary Stuart" and "Norman Conquests"?"
showScoreExcerpt: This production restores the deep melancholy that can be lost when the play is performed as a vaudeville turn, and it finds the terror within the comedy.
